section.name: The <hst:content> tag
section.p: <hst:content> gets the value of a property from a context object.

Following table shows the attributes of the tag. An attribute's value is first found by the directly available value, subsequently by a configuration key if present, then by a default value. A configuration key is a key in the configuration file normally called hst.properties, as given by a web.xml context parameter (see here).

tr.td: The name by which to get a context object from request, overriding the configured or default name.
The required name of the property to show.
The optional variable name by which the property value is set as request attribute. If given, no output is written to the jsp directly.
